Based on the most recent coverage that surfaced in the search results, the biggest SpaceX story right now is the **June 19 2025 static‑fire test of Starship flight 36** at the company’s Boca Chica launch site in Texas.  

- During the test the vehicle suffered a **catastrophic explosion** roughly 4 seconds after ignition, with the fire appearing to originate from the upper (forward) section of the booster.  
- Early speculation points to an **engine‑out or structural issue** in one of the Raptor engines—or possibly a problem with the propellant feed—though SpaceX has not yet released an official technical cause.  
- The incident is expected to **delay the planned orbital flight debut of Starship** by several weeks while engineers conduct thorough investigations and rebuild any compromised test hardware.  
- Despite the setback, SpaceX’s leadership (often referred to as “马老板” in Chinese media) remains confident that the data gathered will accelerate design refinements for future missions, including the long‑term goal of **Mars crewed flights and deep‑space cargo deliveries**.  

In addition, ongoing coverage highlights SpaceX’s continued development of the **Starship launch system**, its work on **Merlin engines** for Falcon boosters, and heightened public interest in joining the company as it pushes toward more frequent launch cadences.
